dating.remarks: [dated] the date is located on top of an old varnish layer [Cat. Coburg 2018, 68]

pageContext.description:
'Recto : The Last Judgement
Verso: St Elisabeth and St Magdalene
The scene is set in a landscape with a bizarre rocky background, in which a castle complex is visible (it recalls the Veste Coburg). St Elizabeth give a poor cripple bread.'
[Maedebach, Exhib. Cat. Coburg 1972, No. 9]

metadata.title: The Last Judgement [recto]; St Elisabeth and St Magdalene [verso]

pageContext.provenance:
- Gotha, Art Cabinet (Kunstkammer) Friedenstein castle, picture gallery
- 1856 Ducal Art and Antiquities Collection, Veste Coburg (Herzogliche Kunst- und Altertümersammlung der Veste Coburg (HKA))
- 1919 Kunstsammlungen der Veste Coburg (KVC) 
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 68]

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
Support:
- fixed in a broad grooved frame (1962)
Varnish:
- the painting has a glossy resin varnish, which was probably applied repeatedly with a brush. The strong fluorescence of this layer restricts the identification of retouches under UV light to a few relatively new ones. 
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 68]

tests.text:
DESCRIPTION

Tools / Materials:
- fluid grey/black medium, brush
 
Type/Ductus: 
- detailed and freehand underdrawing
- fine and broader lines, long and unbroken in combination with some shorter strokes; some hatching-strokes
 
Function: 
- relatively binding for the final painted version; lines delineate contours, define shapes and features; some representation of volume (with hatching strokes)
 
Deviations:
-  minor alterations made during the painted version to clearly define form  
 
INTERPRETATION

Attribution: 
- the underdrawing was executed by an independent workshop member, either while he was still in the workshop or after (Meister IW?, Hans Kemmer?) 

Comments:
- probably with reference to a preparatory drawing 

[Smith, Sandner, Heydenreich, cda 2012]

Identification of wood species: fir

[Klein report, 03.03.2016]

- fir wood

- seven vertically aligned and butt-joined planks. Plank I: 13.7 cm; plank II: 12.8 cm; plank III: 11.8 cm; plank IV: 11.4 cm; plank V: 25.3 cm; plank VI: 12.5 cm, plank VII: 3.4 cm

- the panel is painted on both sides
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 68]

- frame after 1962 by Pfefferle, Munich; the panel is fixed in the grooved frame, dimensions: 136 x 109.5 x 5.4 cm
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 68]

pageContext.signature:
Artist's insignia bottom right: winged serpent and dated '1519'
Insignia and date are located above an old varnish layer [Cat. Coburg 2018, 68]
